intro: Chilita echinaria, commonly known as the spiny chilita, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the dry season. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it access water from underground sources. Chilita echinaria is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in areas with low rainfall.
